[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 70]
Reasoning: **Analyzing card gameplay rules**

I'm trying to clarify the rules around playing cards in this game. It seems better to play four scoring cards and one non-scoring card, and I can play a maximum of five cards but might not need to play all five. For example, using four specific cards creates two pairs, leaving one card in hand to boost the multiplier. I'm also figuring out how the multipliers from various cards like Droll and Gros Michel work, especially with the polychrome edition.
**Calculating multipliers for cards**

I'm figuring out the multipliers based on my card choices. It seems that Droll gives an x1.5 multiplier, even without a flush, and this is independent of other factors. I start by calculating the base multiplier for two pairs and adding values from other cards. I realize I need to adjust my final calculation since I want to reach at least 2009. The final multiplier comes out around 45, giving a total of 1980 chips, which is just under my goal.
**Exploring card combinations**

I'm trying to figure out the best fifth card to use, like 8♣ or 6♣, but they don’t really help with my scoring since only the four pairs count, and kickers don't score. I could consider a full house with QQ and 22, but I need a third of a kind. I'm thinking about playing pairs instead; if I use a pair of 2s, Even Steven gives me bonuses for including even cards. When all calculations are done, the total comes to 630 chips, which feels a bit low.
**Calculating potential scores**

Using the high card with the foil 2♣ gives me a nice bonus of +50 chips, leading to a chip total of 57. When I calculate the multipliers, Even Steven adds another +4. But even with these multipliers, I still come up short at just under my goal. I start considering other options, like playing two pairs with kickers, but it seems I need to find a few more chips to reach 2009. I wonder about the order in which I activate jokers, especially since some of them have already been triggered.
**Finalizing card choices and multipliers**

I just realized that some cards are dependent on scoring while others aren’t, clarifying their roles in the game. I sorted the order of jokers; Crafty does give bonus chips for flushes but doesn’t apply to my hand. After calculating, I find that playing two pairs of queens and 2s works well, especially since using the foil 2 gets me an extra +50 chips. My total finally comes to 94 chips, and with the right multipliers, I can easily exceed 2009. I’m feeling good about this hand!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
